p: The review by Gupta and coworkers [ 55] found that the EOs from leaves were dominated by dihydrotagetone (2.7–54.2%), ( Z)-β-ocimene (1.4–16.1%), ( E)-tagetenone (0.1–19.5%), ( Z)-tagetenone (tr–31.4%), ( E)-tagetone (0.8–14.5%), ( Z)-tagetone (6.6–28.2%), limonene (2–12.4%), eugenol (16.5%), isobornyl acetate (0.4%), p-menth-4-en-3-one (0.1%), sabinene (0.6–1.1%), and terpinen-4-ol (1.3%).
